title: Shinichi Muto
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager.
Playing career.
Muto was born in <a href="Sendai">Sendai</a> on April 2, 1973. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="JEF%20United%20Chiba">JEF United Ichihara</a> in 1992. He debuted in 1994 and became a regular player as left side back and left side midfielder from 1997. In 2000s, he mainly played as defensive midfielder. In 2003, his opportunity to play decreased and he moved to <a href="Oita%20Trinita">Oita Trinita</a> in June 2003. From 2004, he played as playing manager for <a href="Iwate%20Grulla%20Morioka">Grulla Morioka</a> (2004–05) and <a href="FC%20Ganju%20Iwate">FC Ganju Iwate</a> (2006-07). He retired end of 2007 season.
Coaching career.
In 2004, when Muto was player, he moved to <a href="Iwate%20Grulla%20Morioka">Grulla Morioka</a> and became a playing manager. He moved to <a href="FC%20Ganju%20Iwate">FC Ganju Iwate</a> in 2006 and became a playing manager. End of 2007 season, he retired from playing career and he left the club.
